explanation: Agent A is correct. The function ws_receive_frame only reads from the parameter frame (it never writes to frame[]), so the pointed-to object can and should be const-qualified per MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. Declaring the parameter as const unsigned char *frame (and updating callers accordingly) satisfies the rule. The other pointer parameters (ssize_t *length, int *type) are written to and therefore must remain non-const. Returning a mutable msg pointer is unrelated. No evidence in the shown code requires frame to be mutable, so the report of a Rule 8.13 violation is valid.
